lead_paragraph: Santino Quaranta signed with D.C. United, rejoining the club after a two-year absence. Quaranta was drafted at 16 by United in 2001, becoming at the time the youngest to sign with an M.L.S. team. He spent five seasons in Washington before being traded to Los Angeles during the 2006 season. Last year, he was traded to the Red Bulls. A toe injury ended his season early.
